content.description: Start directly under the "nose" at the top of pinnacle, staying on face and not using crack and overhang system to your right, pull nose at top to finish, not pulling nose drops grade to a 5.6
content.protection: Top rope, anchor to trees at the top of the cliff. They are set back a bit, depending on what part of the cliff that you are on, so bring along some static line, or webbing to extend the anchor.

content.description: Start on the near vertical face covered in lichens. Work your way up the face, staying left towards the top. Do not use the dihedrals directly under the roof. Once you get to the top work left and the pull the roof. Finish the slabby upper portion to the topout.
content.location: Along Tunnel Rd just past the entrance of the tunnel you will see a stretch of boulders. About halfway down you will find a short near vertical wall covered in lichens. Start at the base of the Licheny wall.

content.description: It is an ok spot if you are in the area, not really worth driving to. Climbs that are up to about 80ft, with a mixed variety of rock quality, some is a bit loose on the right side of the cliff. The left side which is less steep has more solid rock. Couple of Trad leads possible, and some top ropes. Bouldering in the area if you look around a bit. No bolts. Solid trees at the top for anchors.
